@context.description: A list of JSON-LD context URIs that define the semantic meaning of properties within the credential.

id.description: A unique identifier (URI) assigned to the product passport. May be a UUID

issuer.description: The organisation that is the issuer of this VC. Note that the "id" property MUST be a W3C DID.  Other identifiers such as tax registration numbers can be listed in the "otherIdentifiers" property.

validFrom.description: The date and time from which the credential is valid.

validUntil.description: The expiry date (if applicable) of this verifiable credential.

description: The Digital Identity Anchor (DIA) is a very simple credential that is issued by a trusted authority and asserts an equivalence between a member identity as known to the authority (eg a VAT number) and one or more decentralised identifiers (DIDs) held by the member.

id.description: The W3C DID of the issuer - should be a did:web or did:tdw

name.description: The name of the issuer person or organisation

id.description: The globally unique ID of the party as a URI, ideally as a resolvable ID.

name.description: The registered name of the party within the identifier scheme.

registeredId.description: The registration number (alphanumeric) of the Party within the register. Unique within the register.

issuerAlsoKnownAs.description: An optional list of other registered identifiers for this credential issuer

CredentialIssuer.description: The issuer party (person or organisation) of a verifiable credential.

id.description: The DID that is controlled by the registered member and is linked to the registeredID through this Identity Anchor credential

name.description: The registered name of the entity within the identifier scheme.  Examples: product - EV battery 300Ah, Party - Sample Company Pty Ltd,  Facility - Green Acres battery factory

registeredId.description: The registration number (alphanumeric) of the entity within the register. Unique within the register.

idScheme.description: An identifier registration scheme for products, facilities, or organisations. Typically operated by a state, national or global authority.

registerType.description: The thematic purpose of the register - organisations, facilities, products, trademarks, etc

registrationScopeList.description: List of URIs the represent the role/scopes of membership for the register. For example ["https://abr.business.gov.au/Help/EntityTypeDescription?Id=19"]

NGRIdentity.description: The identity anchor is a mapping between a registery member identity and one or more decentralised identifiers owned by the member. It may also list a set of membership scopes.

id.description: The globally unique identifier of the registration scheme. The scheme should be registered and discoverable from vocabulary.uncefact.org/identifierSchemes

name.description: The name of the identifier scheme.

IdentifierScheme.description: An identifier registration scheme for products, facilities, or organisations. Typically operated by a state, national or global authority.
